caption: Fantastic!

Okay so this place is phenomenal. As soon as you walk in, you are catered by staff. Each move is anticipated and thoughtful. It feels as if you have your own service staff dedicated towards your table. The interior is stunning. The food was even better. Taste spread of cheeses/meats as well as a lasagna, pesto pasta and dessert. Can't wait to come back.
Great service karlota was amazing..great environment
It’s just perfect ✨
Great place to sit and enjoy scenery.
Outdoor dining is perfect for a sunny weekend. Delicious food and friendly staff!

Awful  service, our waitress Russian Olga was very unfriendly nasty and too busy texting and using her cellphone on the floor instead of taking care of her guests! Super salty food and recycled wine from the previous week! Ohh I forgot to mention the bugs and roaches croling on the sofa as well. Stay away and avoid at all cost this cheap Italian saloon.

Awful  service, our waitress Russian Olga was very unfriendly nasty and too busy texting and using her cellphone on the floor instead of taking care of her guests! Super salty food and recycled wine from the previous week! Ohh I forgot to mention the bugs and roaches croling on the sofa as well. Stay away and avoid at all cost this cheap Italian saloon.
Excellent,  can't wait to go back

A great hidden gem tucked away in the Seaport. Service and food quality are a standout and as expected for the brand. Ambience is perfect for a nice, slow, and tasty meal. A great place to either unwind or share a special experience. Definitely worth a visit.

We visited recently and dined in their outdoor setup. It was comfortable and spacious. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, offering suggestions for drinks and our meals. Jordy was extremely personable and helpful! The food and drinks were excellent, as expected. I highly recommend.
Food was very good and wait staff was very attentive
Good food
Great Food , great service all according Cipriani Tradition
New favorite spot in the Seaport. All the service staff were super friendly and attentive, and Max was hilarious! Seafood crudo was delicious and the Antinori didn’t disappoint
Probably one of the best place where enjoying genuine Italian plates in NYC
Great place

Amazing place with amazing food. The truffle fettuccine with cream sauce was a dreamy experience and one of the best dish Ive had to taste and trust me Ive gone to many high end restaurants that pasta was too good. It’s located in a nice area too not far from Brooklyn bridge.
Excellent food and service! I highly recommend the gnocchi and tiramisu!
Disappointed.
Very nice place,food is insane:)
Fantastic food and service is superb. Perfect meal!

(Translated by Google) We had breakfast for $ 250 this morning. An orange juice cost $ 9, and small toasts were put on the table, although we did not order, of course, $ 30 were charged. The food was good, but extremely overpriced.  (Original) Wir haben an diesen Morgen für 250 Dollar gefrühstückt. Ein Orangensaft kostete 9$, zudem wurden uns kleine Toastdreicke auf den Tisch  gestellt obwohl wir es nicht bestellt hatten, wurden natürlich 30$ in Rechnung gestellt. Das Essen war gut, jedoch extrem überteuert.
(Translated by Google) Overpriced .. not worth it!  (Original) Überteuert.. lohnt sich nicht!

(Translated by Google) Food was okay, but when the bill came, we could hardly believe what we see. For a small glass of orange juice we paid $ 9, for half a toast that was put down $ 3, × 10 = $ 30. Then there were added any fees that were not normal. The price-performance ratio was completely wrong. Avoid this restaurant unless you want to be ripped off.  (Original) Essen war zwar okay, aber als dann die Rechnung kam, konnten wir kaum glauben was wir sehen. Für ein kleines Glas Orangenjus haben wir 9$ bezahlt, für ein halbes Toast das hingestellt wurde 3$, × 10 = 30$. Dann kamen noch irgendwelche Gebühren hinzu die auch nicht normal waren. Das Preis- Leistungsverhätnis war komplett daneben. Meidet dieses Lokal unbedingt, ausser ihr wollt abgezockt werden.
Beautiful place, small cozy restaurant. Food is great and service, amazing! When I come back to NY, will stay again at Mr C and will come back here!

Four stars for the room. I really enjoy the room. It's well appointed. I feel like I'm in Europe here. The food however is overpriced and just ok. We had the pasta in bellini sauce (like a vodka sauce) and the tortellini. Too bad the taste of the food doesn't match the decor and the beautiful dinnerware. I would go back to sit in the room and have a few glasses of wine, a coffee, and a panani. The bread basket is astounding. We're in the neighborhood and have eaten at all of 5 Italian restaurants near Front St. I'd suggest ramping up the food program so the taste is up to par with the pricing. There are better Italian restaurants next door and down the street.
Nice location, decent food.
Delicious sea bass
Beautiful venue.
To that

Went for brunch. Room and service were very pleasant and we enjoyed both. But the food....   Very unimpressive and horribly overpriced. Not imaginative and tiny little portions.   The $22 burger was ridiculous - white bread role and 3oz patty with American cheese. Was kids menu at best. Fritata was a joke also.
Drinks were good
Pleasant. Upscale.. kind of felt out of place in seaport though.

We ate at this restaurant twice while staying at Mr. C hotel. Our dinner was fine, but certainly not worth the pricetag. I ordered the shrimp scampi ($30) but there were maybe 5 pieces of small shrimp. It was mostly pasta in an OK tomato sauce. My husband ordered the veal parmesan. It was $40 for three small pieces of meat and a small dish of chopped tomatoes on the side. And it tasted no better than Olive Garden.  For breakfast the next morning, everything tasted better but something happened in the kitchen. We were seated rather quickly. It was kind of early and there weren't too many guests in yet. We placed our orders. More diners funneled in. And then it seemed like the kitchen just slowed to a grinding halt. Nearly every table in the restaurant was full, but no one had any food, including us. About 45 minutes after we placed our orders, our dishes arrived.  I'd expect that wait for myabe a rotisserie chicken, but it's kind of long wait for something like scrambled eggs and bacon.
The best restaurant in the seaport. Great food, phenomenal service.
Would definitely recommend trying this place. Great mood, fresh dishes, awesome customer service. Great work.
Good food
best pasta in all of Nyc hands down
Not bad, but for the location and price it was a little disappointing. Good service. Our waiter Daniel was very friendly and helpful.

Bellini (named so after the much celebrated mixed drink, invented, according to the tradition, by Giuseppe Cipriani, a Venetian bartender and the patriarch of the Cipriani family who owns Mr C Seaport hotel where the restaurant is located) doesn't operate its own website. Thus the menu can be looked at Mr C Seaport hotel's website only. The prices are not listed. After having our lunch there we wonder why. Our lunch, consisting of 2 appetizers (crudo tasting and grilled octopus), 1 Fritto Misto (seafood mixed grill), one "budget" pasta (cacio e pepe, usually the cheapest pasta), 1 shared dessert and 2 glasses of wine cost us MORE than a full 3-course dinner with a bottle of good southern Rhône wine, by a Michelin-star chef, on the same evening. That is not right, neither it is justified by the food quality, plating nor service. The service was friendly but definitely inept. The crudo tasting of three different fishes was not presented nor explained, we still have no idea what were we eating. While the crudo tasting was good, and so was our grilled octopus with eggplant puree, the main courses ranged from very ordinary (bucatini cacio e pepe) to mediocre (fritto misto) to outright poor (macedonia di frutto dessert). The breakfast prices were better but the food resulted, again, in mixed impressions. The Venetian frittata was quite decent but the avocado toast was atrociously bad, served on a godawful joke of a toast. Sometimes a high quality hotel doesn't find a good match in its "house" restaurant. Our experience in Bellini completely fit the negative stay at Mr C Seaport, of which there is a dedicated review left.
This is a really nice place with decent prices. The Bellinis are fantastic!

Food and drinks are good. But the waiters and staff need some work while we were eating our dinner they booked too many people and actually had to physically move our table down.  To have another group basically sit with us. I wouldn't mind if this was a diner but if you want to act upscale you need to play the whole part. And not adjust a table in the middle of our meal.
Never been there

Awful and disgusting service, Roach in my food and disgraceful racist Russian waitress Olga. In addition one of the Italian Manager Emauele racist behavior toward blacks customers is unacceptable and we will report him ASAP. This restaurant had been recommend to us by a close friend so we went Friday night for my 10 years old daughter birthday celebration. We had the table in the front next to the bar area. Our Russian Waitress Olga was absolutely unprofessional, rude and racist individual that doesn't belong working with the public nor in a Restaurant. Our Blonbie Russian waitress Olga, that doesn't even speak proper English, needs to be fired immediately and doesn't have any fine dining experience whats so ever. She didn't even know how to greet us in a professional manner. We waited at least 30 minutes at the table before we got to order our drinks which 2 out of 3 were delivered wrong. After complaining that there was a bug (roach) into our food, our waiterress Olga finanlly decided to ignore us and to simply walk away by calling me a P..t.a. in Spanish which translated in English means B..t..h. In addition she refused to remove my gnocchi from the check! We asked him to bring us bread at least 3 times and never got any. Also we never ordered a bottle of Pellegrino and was never taken off our guest check. Our Mr Italian Emauele Manager has ZERO hospitality and absolute NO fine dining experience. Very rude, uneducated and unprofessional dude that doesn't belong working in a Restaurant. He didn't even congratulated my 10 years old birthday girl. The White wine bottle ordered from Christian another Mexican waiter was the wrong bottle because i ordered a bottle of Prosecco and instead Christian brought us a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. We sat down at 7 and didn’t get our apetizers and salads till 8:05pm Also our main courses were served after another 50 minutes later. My daughter (Birthday Girl) had an allergic reaction to the pasta simply because we asked our waiter that she has allergic to gluten and could have gotten really sick. Instead our waitress Olga never confirmed with the kitchen that my daughter need it a gluten free pasta and instead he ordered the regular gnocchi from the menu with a Roach bug inside. I can confirm that we never ordered the gnocchi but instead of serving my daughter gluten free pasta they served her gnocchi, which is made with regular flour with gluten. Also they brought us the wrong dish to my husband because we never ordered the Salmon simply is allergic to seafood. My question is whom in the right mind would serve gluten to a 10 years old girl with gluten allergy? Just incompetent and not skilled waiter and a poor Restaurant with zero Management. Also very aggravating is the fact that 3 out of the 4 main courses came out cold not to talk about my daughter gluten free pasta that never made it to the table. Our Ravioli Tartufo Bianco were Cold, the Octupus Carpaccio wss extremely salty and the Lamb Chops were too tough, overcooked and cold. I asked for temperature Med Rare and not Well done. Very disappointed with our meal. When a complaint was filed to our Waiter-Manager Emanuele he simply walked away his answer was “this is not true” or “you didn’t wait that long for salads or main courses and didn't removed the gnocchi ( with a bug inside) from our check" Very bad customer service on his part. Whatever happened to pleasing the customer. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND
Unbelievable food and service, place is gorgeous. most authentic Italian restaurant in Manhattan. A must

Very charming setting with unbeatable service. Food was good but not remarkable. The only dish that stood out and didn't seem overpriced was one of the three deserts that we tried. Unfortunately it was a Mimosa Cake that was only available as a daily special. Probably a nice place for a date though.
Good
A little pricey for the value
Great food and service
Sexy atmosphere.. love the decor. Great staff and food. Had a great time celebrating my buddies James 50th Birthday.

(Translated by Google) Definitely better than many Italian starred restaurants! In New York it's hard to eat so well. Just out of the chaos of Manhattan  (Original) Sicuramente meglio di molti ristoranti stellati italiani! A New York è difficile mangiare così bene. Appena Fuori dal caos di Manhattan

(Translated by Google) Fantastic Italian restaurant run by Paolo, a very good Italian manager. Excellent quality of the ingredients that for the most part come from Italy. Excellent service.  (Original) Fantastico ristorante italiano gestito da Paolo, un bravissimo manager italiano. Ottima qualità degli ingredienti che per la maggiorparte provengono dall’Italia. Ottimo il servizio.

It’s the same story every time at a Cipriani restaurant.  You can always count on the place being simply elegant. You can always count on the food being consistently good. FINALLY you can also ALWAYS count on the service being disorganized, slow and disappointing.  Hubby and I tried Bellini for Christmas.  We were so hoping things would be different at this new spot.  It wasn’t.  Got a song and dance story by some of the staff that since it was Christmas waiters and help called in sick etc.  that might have been true.  It’s always the same though at other times we’ve gone to the one on Wall Street.  Leaves a dissatisfied taste in your mouth.  Shout out however to Paolo. He works hard to hold it all together. A gem.

Amazing. We happened upon this place after getting  scammed with a shady boat tour, and it was exactly the amazing place we needed after that. So here’s my review: Space/decor: 5/5 Cute decorations, really cozy space. Service: 5/5 Left nothing to be desired. Waiters were amazing. Bathrooms:4/5 I’m docking off a star because there wasn’t any towels in 2 of the bathrooms. There were a ton of towels in the one bathroom though (?). But the bathrooms were nice and clean. Food: 5/5 The veggies and cheese were amazing, as was the bread and the main course. We got the lasagna, the gnocchi, cacio de Pepe (sorry for spelling), tuna carpaccio,and salad. It was all astoundingly good. For dessert, we got lemon pie, tiramisu, profiterls and creme brûlée. The lemon pie was amazing, the tiramasu was great, the profiterls were soooo good, and the creme brûlée was splendid. Overall, an amazing restaurant. Definitely go. •EDIT• We also got amazing coffee and cocktails.

(Translated by Google) Exellent restaurant. I loved it.🤩🤩 If I come back to New York I will come back with great pleasure.  (Original) Exellent restaurant. J ai adoré.🤩🤩 Si je reviens à new York je reviendrai avec grand plaisir.

(Translated by Google) I found everything fantastic: from the attention, unbeatable, to the food and decoration. Thank you!!  (Original) Me ha parecido todo fantástico: desde la atención , inmejorable, a la comida y decoración. Gracias!!

Congratulations for the incredible experience that I had with my girlfriend in the venue tonight.  Not in special about the food, but also for the AMAZING service offered for the waiter Mr. Fabio. I'd been in other NY restaurants, such as Blue Hill and Nobu, but I never had feel the same "friendly and professional" treatment. Definitely, he has an unique and special service.  PS.: The bar woman was so kind as well.  All the best.
Lovely food and great service by our waiter Fabio made all the difference. Very thoughtful and warm. Our bar woman was also exceptional. We loved it and will be back for sure!
This small intimate restaurant has a luxurious interior, excellent food, and friendly attentive service.
Very enjoyable experience. Branzino was great.
